text: hello the sous-chef John from food
wishes calm with roasted yellow potatoes
and you might be thinking why is he
wasting a video on roasted potatoes I
know how to do those well yeah you do
but there's a technique that I like to
do once in a while it's an extra step
but it's oh so extra special what we're
going to do is we're going to cut up our
potatoes I got these just yellow
beautiful yellow potatoes I think they
might be yellowfin although I really
cannot confirm their lineage I cut those
in half I'm going to bruise some
rosemary which just means pound it a
little bit with the dull edge of the
knife that releases all those nice oils
so throw that in a couple bay leaves a
couple cloves of garlic some salt
alright once it comes to a boil we're
going to only let that boil for five
minutes then we're going to drain it and
we're going to let them air dry
thoroughly so what this initial cooking
did it converts the starch and the
outside of the potato into something
that will get kind of nice and crispy
and crusty in the oven also that
aromatic salty water kind of permeates
the potato a little bit and flavors it
then once the potatoes are thoroughly
dry dump them back in the pot a little
bit olive oil a little bit of cayenne a
little bit of salt not too much because
they've already been boiled in that
brine we're gonna put those on a sheet
tray into an oven 375 Oh check it out my
wife Michelle was already making a
cherry thing all right into the oven 375
for how long I don't know
35 minutes 40 minutes 45 minutes depends
on the size of your potatoes but you're
gonna cook them until the outside is
golden brown the outside is going to get
kind of crusty the inside gets all
creamy and just amazing oh man I love
this technique for potatoes and yes one
extra step boiling potatoes first okay
it's not like I asked you guys do a lot
of extra steps in fact I'm usually
saving your steps so you owe me one so
if you have it toss a little fresh

of burst of aroma kind of nice by the
